htaccess can't work. Apache mod_rewrite is disabled. Please enable it

Example

sudo a2enmod rewrite && sudo service apache2 restart

Routing rules can't work. Try to fix it

Example

For Apache

Open the File /etc/apache2/apache2.conf

Go to lines likes those

            <Directory /var/www/>
                Options Indexes FollowSymLinks
                AllowOverride None
                Require all granted
            </Directory>

Change AllowOverride line to AllowOverride All

For lighttpd

Open the File /etc/lighttpd/ligttphd.conf

Add the rule, and replace your path for the installed app. Example /var/www/html/owmp

            url.rewrite-once = (
                "^Fullpath of your app instalation/AJAX/([^\?]+)(\?(.*))?" => "Fullpath of your app instalation/AJAX/routing.php?route=$1&$3"
            )

page.name: help
page.phrase: We select (with the help of the navigation menu in directories) the linux path of the folders in our music. We choose whether it is Music (mp3, m4a) or Music Video (mp4, m4v).

At convert_alac_files, we put true if we want to convert ALAC files to plain mp3

In playlist_limit we put the number of records that will be displayed on each page in the playlist. For default, it has a value of 150. Be careful if we put a large number, because you will have a performance problem

At dir_prefix we put the starting string of path for our files. This especially when we want to sync with itunes. Read below in more detail about this. By default has '/'. We do not mind if we do not care about sync with itunes.

In syncItunes, we set true if we want to sync with itunes. We have it in true to do the synchronization. After making the synchronization, we put it back in false, otherwise it will be delayed after synchronization, without any reason.

date_format has the format based on which the dates will be displayed. eg D-m-y to appear in the format 14-12-2010.

At icecast_server we put the icecast server address (eg myserver.com:8000)

At icecast_mount we put the mount of that stream (eg myradio)

At icecast_user we put the icecast server user

At icecast_pass we put the icecast server password

In icecast_enable, we set true if we want to enable sending the current song to the icecast server. Otherwise false

In jukebox_enable, we set true if we want to activate vote.php for voting. Otherwise false

In default_language we enter the default language code. eg gr or en or fr

Youtube_api has the youtube API key. We leave it as it is if we do not want to put our staff in

The play_percentage has the percentage that when a song is passed, it is considered that this has been played once more

The max_video_height has the maximum resolution (height) of the video to be downloaded from youtube. eg 240, 360, 480, 720, 1080, 1440, 2160, etc

The low_audio_bitrate has the bitrate to convert songs, if you choose it

The fw_step has the step for backward/forward (in seconds) playback

CAUTION: When you change any of these values, you must refresh the application to get the new value

If we set them all, we select the media type we want and press Synchronization. Synchronization can take from a few minutes to many hours. Depending on how large our collection is. Of course for video clips much more than mp3, because they read larger files.

In the text area, we are copying the youtube links (or the youtube playlist links) that we want to download, separated by ','. Press Download Youtube and wait for it to come down

WARNING: To download from youtube, we must have a music video path (if we want to download music video) or music path (if we want to download audio) to the Collection/File Paths. They must have writing rights for linux user www-data.

To download from youTube we need to install youtube-dl (https://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/download.html)

eg

sudo wget https://yt-dl.org/downloads/latest/youtube-dl -O /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
sudo chmod a+rx /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl

If you fail to download a video, it will usually be due to changes made by YouTube. We are trying to update youtube-dl by running the following command and trying to download the video again

sudo youtube-dl -U

If it still can not download, we update youtube-dl again in the next few days

We create a playlist by clicking on the relevant option at the top of the page. After we create we then choose it at the drop down menu

When a playlist is selected, it will be active, and each time we click on the Add to playlist icon for each song, the song will be added to this playlist. We can also press the shortcut "A" to add the song currently playing to the active playlist.

To load a manual playlist, select the playlist and click on the play icon to the right of the menu

Likewise, we can erase a playlist by pressing the delete icon

When we are in a manual playlist, the "Add to playlist" icon changes to a remove from playlist icon. This means, of course, that by pressing this button, this song is removed from that playlist.

Each user has their own playlists and can not be seen by anyone else.

We can export the current playlist to transfer the corresponding files and metadata to another possible installation. A current playlist is either our entire collection or the collection after selecting some filters. eg The music videos of a particular band.

Once we've selected the filter we want, click the list export icon to the top right. After we click OK on the confirmation that it requests, it starts and copies all files (based on the filter) into a special folder. At the same time, it extracts a playlist.json file that contains all the metadata of the playlist (titles, artists, and more).

WARNING: Exporting to the "outputFolder" folder we have selected in Download Paths

Once the export is done, we get the music files from the outputFolder and copy them to the folder where the music files will be in the new installation. Within the output folder will be the playlist.json file. This is what we get and put it in the root of the web folder that we have installed the application (eg /var/www/html/newOWMLP/)

After making the copies, go to the application (in the new installation) on the Collection screen. We press "JSON import" to insert the playlist metadata on the basis of the new installation.

Then we click "Synchronization" to read and synchronize new files. The application will automatically see the files corresponding to the metadata.

After we complete the process go and erase the contents of the outputFolder of the original installation so that it does not go and reads it in the next synchronization we will do.

WARNING: First, import metadata and then Sync. If it is upside down, then the files will be passed to the collection without the correct metadata.

NOTE: The export/import feature does not currently carry the album covers for the audio music.

Samba sharing if the disks are not on the same machine as the web server

We share the samba disk (either from linux or from windows or from Mac OS) and we mount the disk on the machine that is the web server. eg Can run on a virtualbox

We permanently put the required line in the file /etc/fstab

eg 

sudo nano /etc/fstab
and we add something like this 
//192.168.1.150/diskname /media/diskname cifs credentials=/home/user/.creds,iocharset=utf8,sec=ntlm,noperm,rw
and then restart or 
sudo mount -a
In /home/user/.creds we put the samba username, password, like this 
username=user
password=pass

To sync with itunes (get all the metadata for each file we have in itunes) we export our playlist to itunes, in xml. We take xml, and call it 'Library.xml' (in any case) and put it in the root directory where our application is on the web server.

In order to synchronize, the paths that itunes have the files are checked with the paths we have the files. eg On mac the path in itunes is in the form of: //localhost/Volumes/disk...... While in linux it has the format /media/disk......

Because the itunes saves (the starting part) is of a different form than the path we have in linux, the application cuts the starting part so that it is properly scanned.

This is why dir_prefix is in the options. If our linux path is in the /media/disk/directory.... then we put "/media/" (with the 2 slashes) for dir_prefix

If our path is /disk/directory.... then we leave it '/'

Then we put true in syncItunes on the options and do the synchronization in the Collection as above.

From itunes takes the metadata artist, title, album, genre, year, date added, play count, date last played, rating.

If we have chosen to convert ALAC, it converts the files into a special folder ("convertedALAC), passes them to the database, and renames the original to file.m4a.converted. Renaming is done, otherwise every time you synchronize it will look again for them. At some point, there will be a script if we want to re-name them all in their original form.

For ALAC conversion we need to install

ffmpeg

lame

eg για ubuntu 

sudo apt-get install ffmpeg
sudo apt-get install lame

Creates smaller versions and thumbnails of album covers for the entire collection. Clean all the garbage.

CAUTION: You must have GD PHP library. Example of installation for PHP 7 in ubuntu

sudo apt-get install php7.0-gd

Needed to create smaller versions and thumbnails of album covers

CAUTION: You must have GD PHP library. Example of installation for PHP 7 in ubuntu

sudo apt-get install php7.0-gd

It backup the database, creating a .sql file from which it can be restore.              The restore can be done either through the application (relative button) or using another              MySQL management tool (eg phpmyadmin)

CAUTION: Depending on how large the database is (and depending on the server's capabilities)              It will take the relevant time. Maybe a few minutes for backup (for very large databases).              Up to a few hours. To restore takes much longer than backup.

It is suggested that you backup once a day

.sql files are saved in the outputFolder

We set the paths that the app needs to download something (eg from youtube)              Or export (e.g., backup files). This means they must have writing rights.

In musicDownloadPath, we put the path where the audio files will be downloaded. Suggested              to be where the other sound files of the collection are

At musicVideoDownloadPath, we put the path where the video clips will be downloaded.              It is suggested to be where the other videoclips of the collection are

At outputFolder , we put the path to which the various exports will be made.              eg sql files from backup

At coverAlbumsFolder, we put the path where the cover albums are saved. It is suggested to be where the other sound files of the collection are

In convertedALAC we put the path to which the ALAC files will be converted.              It is suggested to be where the other sound files of the collection are

We create a smart playlist by clicking on the relevant icon on the left

After selecting the smart playlist we created, we select the search fields we want,              And then click the icon to save the smart list

To open a smart playlist, do the corresponding procedure by clicking the icon for              Opening a smart list
